poem:
Title: "Again They Say - Never Again"

In the searing echo of truth's scorn, 
blood pays for the dawn of deceit reborn.
Virtues clatter in cold halls, silence broken,
By the worn-out phrase, ruefully spoken.
In the shadow of hills, in the flame's stark glare,
Through the postman's woe, through the solemn prayer,
Canned sincerity births the bitter refrain - 
"This. Must. Never. Be. Again."
